data.question: What is the formula of MIL-125?
At what temperature was MIL-125 calcined to remove the solvent?
What is the BET surface area of MIL-125?
Is MIL-125 thermally stable up to 360°C under air atmosphere?
Does MIL-125 exhibit photochromic behavior upon UV-visible excitation?
What is the role of titanium in MIL-125's structure?
data.answer: Titanium acts as a center for photoinduced electrons, contributing to the material's photochromic behavior.

data.question: Can MIL-125 be considered a promising candidate for smart photonic devices due to its properties?
What is the experimental C/Ti ratio found in MIL-125?
Does the structure of MIL-125 change after rehydration at room temperature?
What phenomenon is analyzed through the use of ESR and UV-visible absorption spectroscopies in MIL-125?
data.answer: The photochemical phenomenon associated with the formation of stable mixed valence titanium-oxo compounds.

data.question: Is the photoassisted reduction of Ti(IV) to Ti(III) in MIL-125 reversible?
What happens to MIL-125 when it is irradiated with UV light in the presence of alcohols?
data.answer: It changes color due to the photochromic effect and exhibits a photoinduced absorption spectrum with new bands in the visible-near-IR range.

data.question: What is the significance of the ESR spectrum at 75 K showing paramagnetic Ti3+ centers in MIL-125?
data.answer: It confirms the presence of Ti(III) species, indicating the reduction of Ti(IV) to Ti(III) upon UV irradiation.

data.question: Does MIL-125 maintain its crystallinity after adsorption of ethanol under UV-light irradiation?
What is the effect of UV irradiation on the color of MIL-125 when alcohols are adsorbed inside its framework?
data.answer: The material changes from white to purple-gray-blue, indicating a fast photochromic effect.

data.question: What is the role of oxygen in the photochemical process of MIL-125?
data.answer: Oxygen back oxidizes the titanium oxocluster, demonstrating a possible photocatalytic property of MIL-125.

data.question: Is the photoinduced paramagnetic signal in MIL-125 correlated with its photocatalytic effect?
What is the accessible theoretical BET surface area of MIL-125 for a nitrogen sized probe molecule?
Does the presence of free H2BDC within the pores of MIL-125 contribute to the partial blocking of the pores?
What is the significance of the ESR spectrum showing anisotropic weak signal centered around g = 2 in irradiated MIL-125 left in air?
data.answer: It suggests the reduction of molecular oxygen into superoxide diatomic [O2-] ions, highlighting the photocatalytic activity of MIL-125.
